alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Orleans; St. Bernard (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 09 at 5:46PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Louisiana, including the following parishes, Jefferson, Orleans and St. Bernard. * WHEN...Until 845 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 544 PM CDT, broadcast media reported heavy rain in the advisory area. Minor flooding is currently ongoing. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... New Orleans, Chalmette, East New Orleans, Gretna, Arabi and Lakefront Airport. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
